text: it's actually a series of satellites in partnership with the US Geological Survey and we have more than 50 years of records of this and it can tell you where there are trees where there are crops um and we've worked you know with people like the US Department of Agriculture to identify which crops um you can tell from space what's growing by when it greens the precise color that it is we can also we have other satellites that can tell us about plant Health um so we have one an instrument on the International Space Station called ecostress that it measures temperature at this really really high Precision um and what it turns out you can learn from that is when plants are water stressed so when plants don't have enough water they get a little bit hotter so they get a fever um and we can see that from space
